intro: Euadenia helenae, commonly known as the Helen's euadenia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in sandy or well-drained soils, often in coastal or heathland environments. Its flowers are usually pink or red, with a unique, clustered arrangement that attracts pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and threatened species.
